release.action: Greatly reduced the number of INCOMING messages. This potentially affects runtime backwards compatibility.

release.description: Documentation! Also, non-blocking wait, metrics on merges, fixes for app servers.
release.action: Splitlog now boasts shiny new user documentation!
Follower and Metric now support multiple non-blocking waiting...
... and this non-blocking waiting can now execute an asynchronous action when it's done.
MergingFollower now supports metrics and is back on par with Follower, feature-wise.
Splitlog logging is now disabled by default. This will prevent endless feedback loops when Splitlog is deployed within a web app.
Tailing will now span the entire lifespan on LogWatch.
MergingFollower.separate() is deprecated in favor of MergingFollower.remove().
LogWatchBuilder becomes part of the public API.
